revue2.titre: DECREASE AND GROWTH OF SMES IN CANADA: The case of Quebec
revue2.descrip: Every year, nearly 7,200 businesses have been closing their doors in Quebec for a good decade. Is this the result of a lack of government programs to think about the future of such an important activity for the economy?

revue3.descrip: The following year will be more difficult for immigrants aiming for Quebec. Accessibility is more limited due to the suspension of two programs, namely the PEQ (Quebec Experience Program) for graduates, and the PRTQ (Regular Skilled Worker Program).

revue4.titre: The risk of collapse of the Canadian economy following Trump's announcement on customs duties
revue4.descrip: Before the arrival in power of the new President of the United States, Donald Trump, scheduled for January 20, 2025, fears are felt at the level of the Canadian economy. In a post published on November 25, 2024 on his Truth Social network, Donald Trump declares this: On January 20, as one of my many first decrees, I will sign all the necessary documents to impose on Mexico and Canada customs tariffs of 25% on all products entering the United States.

revue5.titre: LE SIAL, an opportunity for agri-food companies to make themselves known
revue5.descrip: You are a company specializing in the production or expansion of food products, and you want to gain value. You have the opportunity to make yourself known internationally thanks to the International Food Show (SIAL) in its 2025 edition which will be held in Canada, precisely in Toronto, from April 29 to May 1, 2025.

act1.descrip: Creation of a digital platform that connects Canadian and African businesses. This platform could allow the sharing of information on products, services, investment opportunities and ongoing projects.

act2.descrip: Organization of webinars on key topics such as market entry, business culture, local legislation and sustainable business practices.
act2.objectif: Provide resources and practical advice to businesses wishing to navigate between the Canadian and African markets.

act3.descrip: Organization of regular trade missions, both in Canada and Africa, to allow companies to meet potential partners and discover local markets.
act3.objectif: Encourage mutual investments and strengthen business relationships

act4.descrip: Organization or participation in trade fairs to showcase companies from both regions. This could include booths, presentations and networking opportunities
act4.objectif: Increase the visibility and reputation of participating companies.

act5.descrip: Establishment of a mentoring program connecting established companies with start-ups or SMEs wishing to develop internationally
act5.objectif: Create a solid network and promote the sharing of experiences.

act6.descrip: Support for innovative and sustainable projects, for example through innovation competitions or business incubators focused on solutions to economic and environmental challenges.
act6.objectif: Promote innovation and sustainable business practices.

act7.descrip: Organization of an annual forum bringing together thought leaders, entrepreneurs and government representatives from both regions to discuss economic opportunities and challenges
act7.objectif: Strengthen cooperation and foster the exchange of ideas.

act8.descrip: Creation of reports, market studies and practical guides on key sectors for trade and investment between Canada and Africa.
act8.objectif: Provide resources and advice to businesses.

act9.descrip: Using social networks to promote businesses, share success stories and provide information on events and opportunities.
act9.objectif: Strengthen the visibility and attractiveness of businesses in both regions.

act10.descrip: Development of specific initiatives to promote exchanges within the Francophonie, such as bilingual events or projects aimed at promoting the French language in the business context.
act10.objectif: Promote inclusive development and the creation of a strong Francophone network.

evennt2.titre: Economic Meeting of Municipalities Canada - Africa (REMCA)
evennt2.descrip: It was conceived and developed by FOC Inc., with the assistance of the Canada-Africa Chamber of Commerce (CCCA), in order to address a specific bilateral issue: How to resolve the crucial problem of manpower in municipal companies as well as economic opportunities, and respond to the challenge of development and modernization of municipalities in French-speaking Africa in particular.
evennt2.descr_tmpl: It was designed and developed by FOC Inc., with the assistance of the Canada-Africa Chamber of Commerce (CCCA), in order to address a specific bilateral issue: How to resolve, in Canada, on the one hand, the crucial problem of labor in municipal companies as well as economic opportunities and how, on the other hand, to respond to the challenge of development and modernization of municipalities in French-speaking Africa in particular, through twinning cooperation, support for training and municipal management as well as strengthening local governance capacities and encouraging international investments and/or public-private partnerships (PPP). The choice of Canada and the French-speaking and Anglephone African countries is linked to a unifying vision under the paradigm of institutional Francophonie. The REMCA aims to make this fair of municipalities a unique moment of sharing urban (or rural), cultural and economic experiences between CANADA and French-speaking Africa. To trace the first pole of direct and institutional international cooperation between Canada and all the countries of French-speaking and English-speaking Africa.

para1.libele: In Canada, the Ministry of Municipalities and Housing embodies a global and integrated vision of the functioning and development of Municipalities, MRCs and ARKs. On the other hand, organizations such as the F√©d√©ration Qu√©b√©coise des Municipalit√©s and the Union Qu√©b√©coise des Municipalit√©s participate respectively in inter-municipal cohesion as well as in promoting the economic and cultural potential of Quebec municipalities through, in particular, the Salon PMEs Municipales (FQM), the Semaine de la Municipalit√© and the Collaboratoire Uni-cit√© (UQM). On the other hand, in French-speaking Africa, the Communes, as they are called, are only slowly beginning to free themselves from the political supervision of the central government. The establishment of the Ministries of Decentralization and Regional Planning in Senegal, Ivory Coast, Burkina Faso, the Democratic Republic of Congo, Gabon and Cameroon, contributes to this new approach to territorial governance focused on the development and autonomy of the Communes. Following this approach, the majority of these French-speaking African countries have set up a supra-municipal organization: the Association of Mayors of Senegal (AMS), the Union of Cities and Municipalities of C√¥te d'Ivoire (UVICOCI), the Association of Municipalities of Burkina Faso (AMBF), the National Association of Cities and Municipalities of the DRC (ANVC/DRC), the Association of Mayors of Gabon (AMG) and the United Municipalities and Cities of Cameroon (CVUC).

para2.opt1: Local development, regional planning, improving the living conditions of populations and supporting businesses have become central and priority missions of municipal organizations throughout the world. As the administrative and political unit closest to the populations, the Municipality must be at the very heart of the social life of each citizen. In order to promote this state of affairs, municipalities develop projects, training, support, partnerships and investments. In the context of partnerships and international cooperation, the twinning model has always prevailed. But today, this model must be improved by putting more emphasis on the idea of ‚Äã‚Äãmunicipalities as a public unit for creating opportunities for SMEs or decentralized economic partnerships. Subsidies and subsidies from central governments no longer meet the requirements of local development and the empowerment of municipalities. We must therefore turn to economic partnerships and especially to international cooperation, in order to make possible opportunities for economic and commercial development between, on the one hand, the municipalities of Quebec and the municipalities of French-speaking Africa; but above all, on the other hand, between companies that are either municipal agencies or that operate within the municipal territory as local growth factors.

para3.libele: This show will be held every two years, alternating between the areas of interest. For example, one edition, especially the first, will be held in a city in the province of Quebec. The following edition, the REMCA will be held in a partner French-speaking African city. It will be a B2B show between interlocutors, thematic conferences, workshops or seminars to strengthen public governance, keynotes,

para4.libele: On both sides, the challenges are centered on:
para4.opt1: local development; how to optimize the quality of life of populations, how to strengthen growth strategies, how to solve the problem of labor and unemployment, how to make local businesses factors of integrated economic growth, how to operationalize the principle of global autonomy of regions?
para4.opt2: land use planning; how to make the infrastructure supply adequate in relation to the ever-increasing and heterogeneous population demand, how to solve the problem of access to quality housing, access to drinking water, to sanitary infrastructures and to available resources?
para4.opt3: Sustainable development; how to formulate development requirements in the preservation of the environment, how to optimize the management and treatment of household waste and wastewater, how to build sustainable public and domestic buildings, how to reforest or preserve local biodiversity?
para4.opt4: Inter-municipality; how to rationalize effective, prolific and productive twinning, how to make possible exchanges of services as well as human, technical and operational resources?

para5.opt1: Facilitate a connection and collaboration between Quebec municipalities and African municipalities
para5.opt3: Make municipalities a lever for economic and commercial cooperation between Canada in general, Quebec in particular, and French-speaking African countries through municipal agencies or local businesses.
para5.opt4: Work on the development of an inter-municipal agreement between Canada and French-speaking Africa, allowing for multi-sectoral exchanges
para5.opt5: Create a Network of Canadian-French-speaking African Municipalities (RMCAF)

This event aims to raise awareness in the Canadian market about the unexplored riches of African coffee and to encourage Canadian processors and distributors to explore this promising market.

evennt5.descrip: The next edition of the Rencontres d'√âchanges, de D√©couverte et d'Exhibition de la r√©gion de l'Ouest (REDEO) in 2024 promises to maintain the structure and spirit that made the previous edition, while introducing a major innovation: *REDEO SPORT*. This new component aims to enrich the REDEO experience by integrating university sports and E-sports, reflecting the commitment of the Western region to the dynamism of youth and the importance of sport in social and economic development.

serv.desc1: The CCCA offers a complete service for business start-ups in Canada. Through its network of entrepreneurship experts in Canada, CCCA members can request our services to help them start and carry out their businesses in Canada or in an African country where it is represented.

desc_entre.txt1: The CCCA offers a complete service for business start-ups in Canada. Through its network of entrepreneurship experts in Canada, CCCA members can request our services to help them start and carry out their businesses in Canada or in an African country where it is represented.
desc_entre.txt2: The CCCA relies on solid partnerships as well as on entrepreneurship support organizations in Canada. Thus, we can suggest innovative business ideas, provide support in writing the entrepreneurial project, the business plan as well as strategic planning, and also the marketing communication plan.
desc_entre.txt3: In addition, the CCCA's support service is structured around its integrated incubator which offers a complete environment and key tools to start a business, open a subsidiary or reactivate a dormant business in Canada and Africa

serv.desc2: The CCCA is above all a French-speaking economic market that connects the Canadian and African Francophonies. It then opens up to the English-speaking economies in order to generate business dynamics driven by the desire to market in French. Through the Francophonie, the CCCA intends to attract diverse economies within an ecosystem drained by the French language. The CCCA also offers spaces for learning French as a business language.

desc_franc.txt1: The CCCA is first and foremost a French-speaking economic market that connects the Canadian and African Francophonies. It then opens up to the English-speaking economies in order to generate business dynamics driven by the desire to market in French. Through the Francophonie, the CCCA intends to attract diverse economies within an ecosystem drained by the French language. The CCCA also offers spaces for learning French as a business language.
desc_franc.txt2: As such, it offers a francization program to any entrepreneur or investor who chooses to settle in Quebec or within French-speaking communities in Canada.

serv.desc3: The CCCA brings together expertise to conduct trade missions both in Canada and in Africa. This service aims to support governments, public or parapublic institutions, non-profit organizations, companies, who wish to carry out a trade, prospecting or exploration mission with a view to generating business development, partnerships or representations.

desc_coope.text1: The CCCA brings together expertise to conduct trade missions in Canada as well as in Africa. This service aims to support governments, public or parapublic institutions, non-profit organizations, companies, who wish to carry out a trade, prospecting or exploration mission with a view to generating business development, partnerships or representations.

serv.desc4: The CCCA has a mandate to attract investors and business people based in Africa who wish to take over a business in general and in Quebec in particular. Repreneurship is an economic program that is particularly promoted by the Quebec government through the Ministry of Economy, Innovation and Energy as well as the Ministry of Immigration, Francization and Integration.

desc_repre.txt1: The CCCA's mandate is to attract investors and business people based in Africa who wish to take over a business in general and in Quebec in particular. Repreneurship is an economic program that is particularly promoted by the Quebec government through the Ministry of Economy, Innovation and Energy and the Ministry of Immigration, Francization and Integration. This program is based on a problem: nearly 25% of those aged 65 and over intend to close their businesses due to a lack of succession. Less than 20% of entrepreneurs residing in Quebec intend to take over existing businesses. More than 60% are more interested in starting a business.

liste.libele: The advantages of the repreneurship program are directly perceptible:
liste.opt1: It is easier to obtain financing because the company already has a financial history and assets
liste.opt2: The company's brand image and reputation are already established
liste.opt3: The products serving the company are already well aligned in a competitive market
liste.opt4: There is little risk of bankruptcy because the company is already in its productive phase
liste.opt5: There is already a relationship between customers and suppliers
liste.opt6: The staff is already sufficiently trained and experienced
liste.opt7: In some camps, the former manager can help make the transition so that the recovery is optimal

serv.desc5: The CCCA offers a business networking program through trade shows, forums, and fairs organized in the form of B to B and B to C meetings, the objective of which is to enable participants to establish or conclude business alliances between Canada and Africa. As such, the CCCA has several business event concepts that are held annually in Canada or in one of the African countries where it has a delegation.

desc_maillage.txt1: The CCCA offers a business networking program through trade shows, forums, and fairs organized as B to B and B to C meetings, the objective of which is to allow participants to form or conclude business alliances between Canada and Africa. As such, the CCCA has several business event concepts that are held annually in Canada or in one of the African countries where it has a delegation.
desc_maillage.txt2: The CCCA also collaborates with organizing partners to attract Canadian delegations of entrepreneurs or investors to participate in economically important events in Africa, and conversely, the latter, through its country delegates, mobilizes African delegations of entrepreneurs and/or investors to take part in business events organized in Canada.

serv.desc6: The Laval Mentoring Network helps entrepreneurs find the mentor who will help them grow. We believe that the success of businesses depends above all on the well-being of the people who run them. We rely on the largest mentoring network in Quebec to provide access to experienced mentors, regardless of the stage of development of the business

desc_mentorat.txt1: The R√©seau Mentorat Laval helps entrepreneurs find the mentor who will help them grow. We believe that the success of businesses depends above all on the well-being of the people who run them. We rely on the largest mentoring network in Quebec to provide access to experienced mentors, regardless of the stage of development of the business
desc_mentorat.txt2: The R√©seau Mentorat Laval offers you the opportunity to join individual mentoring, group mentoring or mentoring in residence.

prog1.descr: Led by mentors with a wealth of entrepreneurial experience, group mentoring meetings aim for sharing and participation of all mentees. This type of support allows entrepreneurs to compare their journey to that of their peers, to discuss both human and practical aspects according to specific themes, and to create a network of entrepreneurs. Group mentoring is complementary to individual mentoring. Around ten monthly meetings led by mentors with a cohort of 8 to 10 entrepreneurs asking the same questions and experiencing similar challenges.
prog1.det1: 9 monthly group meetings of 3 hours led by a mentor.

prog2.descr: Individual mentoring offers you 100% personalized support focused on your personal challenges. You will develop a long-term relationship with your mentor, based on trust and confidentiality. YOU are the master on board of the topics to be discussed, according to your schedule and your needs. and there is no limit to the number of meetings between the mentor and the mentee.
prog2.det1: Unlimited meetings of 1 to 2 hours with a mentor
prog2.det2: Monitoring the quality of the mentoring relationship
prog2.tarif: $50/month including membership in the National Mentoring Network, giving you access to numerous privileges with our partners.

prog3.descr: Mentoring for collective entrepreneurs was set up to help leaders of non-profit organizations (NPOs) or cooperatives with their specific challenges. By registering, you will benefit from the support of mentors with experience in business management and development such as yours. They will be able to support you in your personal and professional journey.
prog3.det1: Unlimited meetings of 1 to 2 hours with a mentor
prog3.det2: Monitoring the quality of the mentoring relationship
prog3.tarif: $50/month including membership in the National Mentoring Network, giving you access to numerous privileges with our partners.

presentationDescription: The Canada Africa Chamber of Commerce is an organization tasked with representing the interests of commercial, industrial, and service-oriented businesses, ensuring entrepreneurial training, and providing business support. It represents professionals in the trade, industry, and service sectors to local and international public authorities within its mission domains. The CCCA undertakes representative, consultative, support, and promotional missions.

servicesData.title: Entrepreneurship
servicesData.description: The CCCA offers a full range of services for business startups in Canada. Through its network of entrepreneurship experts in Canada, CCCA members can request our services to support them in starting and growing their businesses in Canada or in an African country where it is represented.

servicesData.title: Francophonie
servicesData.description: The CCCA is primarily a Francophone economic market that connects Canadian and African Francophone communities. It then opens up to Anglophone economies to encourage business dynamics driven by the desire to trade in the French language.

servicesData.title: Business Acquisition
servicesData.description: The CCCA is dedicated to attracting investors and entrepreneurs based in Africa who wish to acquire a business in general and particularly in Quebec.

servicesData.title: International Cooperation
servicesData.description: The CCCA brings together expertise to conduct trade missions in both Canada and Africa.

servicesData.title: Business Networking
servicesData.description: The CCCA offers a business networking program through exhibitions, forums, and fairs organized in the form of B-to-B and B-to-C meetings.

servicesData.title: Training
servicesData.description: This training program is provided by business development experts based in both Canada and Africa.

servicesData.title: Incubations
servicesData.description: Through its "CCCA-Propuls" incubation and acceleration program, the CCCA supports Canada-based entrepreneurs from ideation to business launch.

mission_title: An Unchanged Mission, an Expanded Vision
mission_content: While our name and reach evolve, our mission remains true to our core values. We aim to be an exceptional hub of economic solidarity and to foster enriching collaboration for business communities on both sides of the Atlantic. Under the enlightened leadership of Dr. Armand, the CCCA will continue to build economic bridges between Canada and Francophone Africa while welcoming new opportunities and Anglophone partners, thus promoting an inclusive and integrated approach.

entrepreneurship_para_1: The CCCA offers a full range of services for business startups in Canada. Through its network of entrepreneurship experts, CCCA members can seek our services to support them in starting and growing their businesses in Canada or an African country where we are represented.
entrepreneurship_para_2: The CCCA relies on solid partnerships and Canadian entrepreneurship support organizations. We can suggest innovative business ideas, assist in creating entrepreneurial projects, business plans, strategic planning, and marketing communication strategies.
entrepreneurship_para_3: Additionally, the CCCA's support service is structured through its integrated incubator, offering a comprehensive environment and essential tools to start a business, open a subsidiary, or revive a dormant business in Canada and Africa.
repreneurship_para: The CCCA's mandate is to attract investors and business people based in Africa who wish to take over a business, especially in Quebec. The government of Quebec, through the Ministry of Economy, Innovation and Energy and the Ministry of Immigration, promotes repreneurship due to a lack of successors. Approximately 25% of business owners aged 65+ intend to close their businesses for this reason.
repreneurship_benefit_1: Easier to secure financing due to existing financial history and assets.
repreneurship_benefit_3: Products and services are well-aligned in a competitive market.
repreneurship_benefit_4: Lower risk of bankruptcy as the business is already productive.
repreneurship_benefit_7: Previous management can assist in transitioning for optimal continuity.
francophonie_para_1: The CCCA is primarily a Francophone economic network connecting Francophone communities in Canada and Africa. It then opens to Anglophone economies to foster business dynamics inspired by a desire to conduct business in French. Through Francophonie, the CCCA seeks to attract diverse economies within an ecosystem fostered by the French language.
francophonie_para_2: The CCCA also offers French learning spaces for business purposes, providing a French-language program for any entrepreneur or investor settling in Quebec or Francophone communities in Canada.
international_cooperation_para: The CCCA consolidates expertise for trade missions in both Canada and Africa. This service supports governments, public or para-public institutions, non-profits, and businesses aiming to conduct trade, prospecting, or exploratory missions to foster partnerships, business development, or representation opportunities.
business_networking_para_1: The CCCA offers a business networking program through exhibitions, forums, and fairs organized as B2B and B2C meetings, allowing participants to form or finalize business alliances between Canada and Africa.
business_networking_para_2: The CCCA collaborates with partner organizers to attract Canadian delegations of entrepreneurs and investors to participate in significant economic events in Africa, and conversely, mobilizes African delegations to participate in business events organized in Canada.
incubation_para: Through its incubation and acceleration program, 'CCCA - Propuls,' the CCCA supports Canada-based entrepreneurs from ideation to business launch. With four tracks, CCCA - Propuls equips you with essential resources to start a business in Canada and see it to fruition.
training_para: The CCCA provides a training program to support entrepreneurs based in Africa from ideation to business launch. With two major types of training, CCCA - Propuls offers essential resources to help start and realize a business in Canada.
leadership_program_title: Leadership and Entrepreneurship Capacity Development Program
leadership_program_description: An in-depth program that connects with top universities to equip leaders with skills in various fields.
repreneurship_program_description: Specialized training aimed at helping entrepreneurs take over existing businesses.

descrip1: Cameroon, often called "Africa in miniature", is a country located in Central Africa, known for its cultural, linguistic and geographical diversity. This diversity enriches its heritage and reflects the harmonious coexistence of several ethnic groups. Cameroon is also renowned for its rich artistic scene, vibrant music and traditional dances, illustrating the spirit and creativity of its people.
descrip2: Despite the socio-economic and political challenges it faces, Cameroon continues to demonstrate remarkable resilience. Cameroonians are committed to building a better future, with a focus on sustainable development and improving the quality of life.

CornerBrookDescription: Corner Brook is an industrial centre for paper mills, and a tourist gateway to Gros Morne National Park.
LabradorCityDescription: Labrador City, the heart of the mining industry, is a major producer of iron ore.
HappyValleyGooseBayDescription: Happy Valley-Goose Bay, with its air base, is a defence and logistics hub.
conclusionTerreNeuveLabrador: Newfoundland and Labrador's cities, including St. John's, Corner Brook, Labrador City and Happy Valley-Goose Bay, are vital to the provincial economy, blending tradition and modernity.
